items.q: It was ____________________ that she felt very tired. She couldn't stop yawning.
What does the ____________________ "on time" mean?
Some ____________________ people have guide dogs to help them get around.
One of his best ____________________ is his ability to solve problems.
The ____________________ in the department store window changes every week.
Janet uses different spices when she cooks to ____________________ the flavor of the food.
____________________ workers usually do not receive health benefits from a company.
____________________ meat is meat without much fat.
It was ____________________ hot yesterdayâ€”over 100 degrees!
There are lots of vitamins in dark green vegetables ____________________ broccoli and spinach.
The top three players on the baseball team are going to received awards. a. players b. are c. received
I do not understand why most peoples watch so much TV. a. understand b. peoples c. watch
Why do the price of groceries keep going up every month. a. do b. groceries c. keep
Only one of the men in my class make himself dinner every night. a. men b. make c. himself
There was no real difference between their argument . a. was b. difference c. argument
I find it interesting that many children does not like certain foods. a. interesting b. children c. does
Who are going to go with me to the concert tonight? a. are b. go c. me
The owner of the injured animals ____ to have surgery performed on them. a. has decided b. have decided
Because severe weather is approaching, the government ____ evacuation orders to all residents. a. is issuing b. are issuing
The hazardous waste experts ____ the damage from the chemical spill. a. has assessed b. have assessed
Our city has four television stations and six radio stations, so everyone ____ to be the first to report the news. a. is competing b. are competing
That group of islands ____ actually a country. a. is b. are
The children and their babysitter ____ a walk to the park. a. is taking b. are taking
The equipment under the stairs____ destroyed by the flood. a. was b. were
Suzanne and her band ____ to perform five times next month. a. is going b. are going
What is the most incredible experience you have ever had? a. descriptive paragraph b. comparison paragraph
What are the parallels between the government systems of two countries? a. descriptive paragraph b. comparison paragraph
How do Russian and American students differ in their study habits? a. descriptive paragraph b. comparison paragraph
If you could add another member to your family, who would it be and why? a. descriptive paragraph b. comparison paragraph
What was the best day of your life? a. descriptive paragraph b. comparison paragraph
How are immigration patterns in the U.S. different from ones hundred years ago? a. descriptive paragraph b. comparison paragraph
How have antibiotics changed the way we respond to many common illnesses? a. cause-effect paragraph b. classification paragraph
How do natural disasters affect local environments? a. cause-effect paragraph b. classification paragraph
How does air pollution from industrial areas change rural areas? a. cause-effect paragraph b. classification paragraph
What are the different kinds of chemicals that control emotion in the brain? a. cause-effect paragraph b. classification paragraph
What are the different therapies that are used to treat depression? a. cause-effect paragraph b. classification paragraph
Which job positions are necessary to run a successful restaurant? a. cause-effect paragraph b. classification paragraph
How did you _____ the situation?
Joshua is happy to spend hours _____ the library.
The movie _____ two hours.
The accident was very _____ for the boy.
Everyone agreed that the speaker had a big impact _____ the class.
There are many important _____ between the two plans.
The two parties _____ on a plan to build new bridges and highways.
What is your _____ of the new instructor?
The fire truck sirens woke up the entire _____.
After the hurricane, people returned _____ their normal lives.
One of the advantages _____ this plan is that we won't have to pay more taxes.
The two primary elements of a topic sentence are the main subject and the controlling idea.
The controlling idea is found in the concluding sentence of the paragraph.
A descriptive paragraph explains the reasons that a certain action happened.
A comparison paragraph shows the similarities and/or differences between two subjects.
You would write a cause-effect paragraph to explain how something looks, feels, tastes, smells, or sounds.
Write about reading books and watching movies. Compare their similarities or contrast their differences. Include a topic sentence that consists of the main subject and a controlling idea.
